name: NBCNews
text:
NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell apologizes to players for not listening to concerns regarding racism

"We, the National Football League, admit we were wrong for not listening to NFL players earlier and encourage all players speak out and peacefully protest" https://t.co/MLO1cSRGyM

name: NBCNews
text: Less than half of all black Americans currently have a job, an employment-to-population ratio that is “massively alarming,” one economist said. https://t.co/zOt9syMdYq

name: NBCNews
text: People are engaging in extremely dangerous behaviors — including gargling with bleach — in an effort to prevent COVID-19, CDC report finds. https://t.co/FaL1eWZYIG

name: NBCNews
text: "The pattern that we see in this case is similar to patterns we've seen in ICE arrests outside of courthouses," one attorney said. "They didn't identify themselves, they terrified him, they were pushing their guns at him" https://t.co/NNYORZFEcr

name: NBCNews
text: US Supreme Court may consider making it easier to sue police for misconduct; justices are weighing the issue known as "qualified immunity," which protects law enforcement. https://t.co/ur6phN2RiO

name: NBCNews
text: Analysis: Black Americans have grown tired of being forced to make the case for their citizenship, their humanity, their very survival — again and again and again. https://t.co/vGVxFcAM5H - @JanellRoss

name: NBCNews
text: A Republican state senator in Virginia is facing backlash from members of her own party after she said that the removal of Confederate statues is an "overt effort to erase all white history." https://t.co/kKdpMFPEH3

name: NBCNews
text: California AG Becerra announced the state's Justice Dept. will undertake an "expansive review" of the Vallejo Police Dept., where police shootings led to protests, accusations of biased policing, lawsuits and residents' demands for an outside investigation https://t.co/jI5Pg6fko3

name: NBCNews
text: A man seen in a video wielding a chainsaw at protesters in Texas has been detained by police, according to the McAllen Police Dept. https://t.co/M7q0KemGsT

name: NBCNews
text: Both officers have been suspended without pay, and their cases have been referred to the Department Advocate for disciplinary action, Police Commissioner Dermot Shea said. https://t.co/4JcsKEndl9

text: RT @DatelineNBC: She’d been missing just two days when the hurricane hit… #Dateline tonight at 10/9c. https://t.co/AMfNPTn3v7

text: Latinos led all groups in joblessness last month, with 17.6% of Latinos unemployed, government data show. https://t.co/Ud9MrLhoMp

text: "The only thing that's really running through my mind is: ‘If I’m going to die, I'm going to die on camera,’” Iyanna Dior said. https://t.co/nApfEJBypR

name: NBCNews
text: President Trump reiterated his stance that NFL players should not kneel in protest during the national anthem in a tweet supporting New Orleans Saints quarterback Drew Brees’ recent comments about protests. https://t.co/jQ1cdmDWWG

text: WATCH: U.S. Army officials deployed to Washington, D.C. say they are relieved to be going home and that they did not want active duty troops called to the city. - @NBCNewsNOW https://t.co/BsXfZLY8om

name: NBCNews
text: "I think there's a bunch of people here that are obviously for this cause," one protest attendee said. "But I think ultimately, we've been locked in our apartments for so long that now we have something to unite us that is actually uplifting." https://t.co/S93xzQiQds

name: NBCNews
text: Fmr. President Obama held a town hall with Rep. John Lewis and young African American men to talk about the death of George Floyd and racial injustice in America. https://t.co/I2K0qa6TDU

name: NBCNews
text: April Baller, a WHO infection control expert, said part of the reason for the widening of WHO's advice on face masks was the increasing evidence COVID-19 can be spread by people before they have symptoms. https://t.co/lGc4NHER5j

name: NBCNews
text: Opinion | Robert L. Johnson: "If you return to Black Americans the wealth that was stolen from them, I believe they will return to you their faith in what you have come to call American exceptionalism." - @NBCNewsTHINK https://t.co/vUqAbjVoHg

name: NBCNews
text: The prime suspect in the disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann is being investigated for possible involvement in a similar crime in Germany, prosecutors said. https://t.co/YpMRucRytV

name: NBCNews
text: "How many times do we need to ask you to listen to your players? What will it take? For one of us to be murdered by police brutality?" New Orleans Saints wide receiver Michael Thomas asks. https://t.co/Utp2E1b4kY

name: NBCNews
text: WATCH: DC Mayor Bowser had city workers Friday paint the words "Black Lives Matter" on the street that leads to the White House where protesters have been demonstrating following George Floyd’s death in police custody. https://t.co/cyDZFID5AI

name: NBCNews
text: President Trump: "Hopefully George is looking down right now and saying this is a great thing that is happening for our country. There's a great day for him. It's a great day for everybody." https://t.co/7s9OFZpUM6

name: NBCNews
text: The U.S. Supreme Court blocked a federal judge's order that required the government to begin moving more than 800 inmates from an Ohio prison who are at risk of catching the COVID-19 virus. https://t.co/8VOpcgOfaH

name: NBCNews
text:
Prosecutors in New York's Eastern District Court have described Sam Shader an an out-of-control criminal determined to riot.

People who know Shader offered a different picture. "She's a regular girl," one friend said. https://t.co/OAgaroUTap
